Drug: MDA | cid: 1614

Erowid name: mda
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: MainPage

                    Text: 
                    MDA



COMMON & BRAND NAMES

Sass or Sassafras [also used for MDMA]

EFFECTS CLASSIFICATION

Euphoric Empathogen; Stimulant; Phenethylamine

CHEMICAL NAME

3,4-methylenedioxyamphetamine

DESCRIPTION

MDA is a synthetic empathogen sometimes found in ecstasy tablets. It is closely related to MDMA though its effects are said to be slightly more psychedelic.

BASICS

EFFECTS

IMAGES

HEALTH

LAW

DOSE

CHEMISTRY

GENERAL INFORMATION #

PiHKAL Entry for MDA

RELATED VAULTS #

MDE Vault

MDMA (Ecstasy) Vault

Nutmeg Vault

Herbal MDMA Replacements

HISTORY #

MDA Timeline

ASK EROWID ANSWERS #

Is "Sass" a natural form of MDMA (or MDA)?

ARTICLES & WRITINGS #

Re-examining MDA Duration, by Earth & Fire Erowid

RESEARCH & JOURNAL ARTICLES #

An unusual clandestine laboratory synthesis of [...] - 2012

Effects of MDMA, MDA and MDEA on blood pressure, heart rate [...] - 2006

A bitter pill. Overview of ecstasy (MDMA, MDA) related fatalities - 2004


                    Context: 
                    This section provides detailed information on MDA, including its common names (Sass or Sassafras), classification as a euphoric empathogen, stimulant, and phenethylamine, chemical name, and description as a synthetic empathogen related to MDMA. It links to related vaults, historical timeline, research articles, and expert Q&A, serving as an in-depth reference within the broader Erowid drug information resource.

It is part of the MDA chemical profile within Erowid's comprehensive database on psychoactive substances, supporting users seeking detailed scientific, experiential, and reference information about MDA.
